values: To panic is to feel so nervous or afraid that one cannot think clearly.
Everyone panicked when the house caught on fire.
n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌 adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的 vt. 使恐慌 vi. 十分惊慌
adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的
vi. 十分惊慌Panic潘神的,牧人之神的

恐慌, 惊慌, 惊恐, 慌张 (noun.)
adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的
To panic is to feel sudden overwhelming fear or anxiety.
Panic is a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety that causes people to act in a frantic or irrational way.
